item.title: Why does this not work?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

You forgot to load ur bitmaps

[code]program oli;

var
okay, x, y: Integer;

procedure LoadBitmaps;
begin
okay := BitmapFromString(44, 10, ‘z78DA8D554996E5280CBC’ +
‘920149C01230DCFF48151A9C6567F5A2D32FC398412842C32FA95’ +

‘A68358DC672800D60FF7885D026A7411CD5F3A50E830C3B716CAA’ +

‘CE4C201FF4B9A0CA972C09C2CEB27389B021A79CBFC0B0CFE4630’ +
‘F0ADC3B8FAE9F7BDF0647DD668A99E165CECCE39C6E88362CFC49’ +
‘3669E692CDEBC24B9876F9BD8B2A6ACB2F25CC1A2E37F991DFE0F’ +
‘3B9AD5D9E2DB80D97617E35978020999DF2CFF3B70DBFA6D99504’ +
‘4F03F64CBAC05593010ED0CEE12DCBDA63C0A4F963EF996DE3ED7’ +
‘517B1D9657C1E5D6E45CB889A0C01A73C47C4D726AAE97EC9A83E’ +
‘F9C032D44FDDDBF6CB6BA603149759FCD4EE4217CBE61052190F3’ +
‘B1A33B9DE301FB2657A0C51DAC3BB47254FD2932614A53CF64551’ +
‘47C59E0AF7D4FA28AA7D5D49387884AD414DEFCA90BCCB9E6503B’ +
‘74D87808370E49B7FE7DFAC91B7D159E6EF9CC234730137821D6F’ +
‘CBFEC3CFB17A2A2A8AA20E2C63D81FD41EE3B77C2B75602435144’ +
‘06AA67C4A87AD5474F7B7ACB7CAA2F32D36BCA34FFE8E06A9BF21’ +
‘F2E1937D6B7FFDE8B2CCA1D9EE440CFA5F1CFD9063F4916DEEC44’ +
‘7FEC74D19C008F7AF9AAED842B66AD806F33BEDD66A688A1EF21B’ +
‘B5D2D1C7CA1162A4189E16A2003B4D759E65BDCC93A0C4757F15F’ +
‘960955A1B246F9E3B345D375FECC9B5793915AB11FD743C6BAEB6’ +
‘A310A8566DE8EA996F2DBCEBA6069D4BB8E7679AF0BBE86DA45’ +
‘AA2AE3D1CBBC2D33BF1A5A965A057935D5D9669D14767AAFBDB7DC’ +
‘528BFD8B179A96D538B9B5D04A95D8A1D5920E5BC6DDEC33BED4B’ +

‘9B51B95B5C45D9E57CF7EDD23764BAB9A9DB3F696EC96FD07291A’ +
‘4877’);
end;

begin
LoadBitmaps;
repeat
if FindBitmap(okay, x, y) then ClickMouse(x, y, True);
ClickMouse(209, 245, True);
Wait(5000);
if FindBitmap(okay, x, y) then ClickMouse(x, y, True);
ClickMouse(190, 245, True);
if FindBitmap(okay, x, y) then ClickMouse(x, y, True);
Wait(15000);
if FindBitmap(okay, x, y) then ClickMouse(x, y, True);
until(False)
end.[/code]

EDIT:
When i try to run this though it errors again, this time on the bitmapinitiation…
So I believe your bitmap is corrupt, try converting it again and replace the one in the script by the new conversion

item.title: Why does this not work?
item.dc:creator: @oliolioli oliolioli
item.description:
@oliolioli wrote:

The script is supposed to do clicking and waiting, and it searches for a bitmap the entire time, when i compile it it says it succeeds, but when I run it it says [Runtime Error] : Exception: Access violation at address 00650650 in module ‘scar.exe’. Read of address 00000000 in line 50 in script

I would appreciate any help I can get

[code]program oli;

var
okay,x,y:integer;

procedure loadbitmaps;
begin

okay := BitmapFromString(44, 10, ‘z78DA8D554996E5280CBC’ +
‘920149C01230DCFF48151A9C6567F5A2D32FC398412842C32FA95’ +
‘C850A97525AA9780F7C158C1C6B11CC74ACDD7803E92A9B883225’ +

‘B5D2D1C7CA1162A4189E16A2003B4D759E65BDCC93A0C4757F15F’ +
